intro: Sophiopsis annua, commonly known as the annual sophiopsis, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, dry seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some regions for its attractive blooms.
